docs.snippet: The Pony Express, with four days' later California news, arrived, this morning, forty hours behind time. SAN FRANCISCO, Tuesday, Oct. 17 3 P.M.

headline.main: LATER FROM THE PACIFIC.; Arrival of the Overland Express News from California and Oregon. COMMERCIAL NEWS. Severe Storm on the Plains. Trouble Reported in Kansas. A Schooner Run Down by a Steamer. News from the State Capital. THE ANTI-RENT SUITS FINALLY DISPOSED OF Attempted Murder and Suicide in Boston. Convicted of Forging Election Returns. The Breckinridge Letter a Forgery. Movements of Senator Douglas. Election in New-Orleans. Suicide in Plymouth, Mass. Steamer Dixie Snagged. Sailing of the Arabia. Obituary. Health at Mobile.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pony Express, with four days' later California news, arrived, this morning, forty hours behind time. SAN FRANCISCO, Tuesday, Oct. 17 3 P.M.

headline.main: NEWS FROM CUBA.; The Late Storm New Motive Power New Public Works Theatrical Miscellaneous. COMMERCIAL.

headline.main: GENERAL CITY NEWS.; "The Jews' Hospital in New-York." BANQUET AND BALL IN ITS AID. The Billiard Tournament. The Ticket Swindlers and Judge Russell. Arrest of a Fugitive from Havana. Young Shoplifters. Police Reports. the Grand Jury. INGENIOUS DEVICES OF ROGUES A YANKEE TRICK. A COURT CLERK ASSAULTED AT A THEATRE. THEFT OF CAMPAIGN MEDALS AND BREASTPINS. A ROBBER ON A STEAMBOAT.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CASE OF HURRY AND THE GAMBLERS. In accordance with a previous arrangement the four men named JAMES STEWART, CHARLES RANSOM, JOHN COLTON and FREDERICK BLACKMAN, who are charged with keeping gambling houses, yesterday were brought before Justice KELLY for examination. It will be recollected that the complaints against these men were...

docs.snippet: THE BILLIARD TOURNAMENT The Billiard Tournament continues to excite great interest, and the room of Mr. LYNCH, in Fourteenth-street, where it is held, is daily crowded to its utmost capacity by gentlemen who feel an interest in the game.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE BILLIARD TOURNAMENT The Billiard Tournament continues to excite great interest, and the room of Mr. LYNCH, in Fourteenth-street, where it is held, is daily crowded to its utmost capacity by gentlemen who feel an interest in the game.

headline.main: NEWS FROM THE NATIONAL CAPITAL; Return of Lord Lyons The Court of Claims Closing Up Political Business The Naval Force in the Pacific &c. Dispatch to the Associated Press. From Tampico and Brazos. From Denver City. Gov. Curtin, of Pennsylvania. Fire in New-Orleans. The Africa Outward Bound.

headline.main: BOARD OF COUNCILMEN.; RECEPTION OF THE PRINCE OF WALES HEALTH WARDENS THE CONTRACT FOR PAVING FORTIETH-STREET AND A DISPUTE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Councilmen met yesterday at 5 o'clock P.M. Councilman HOGAN was appointed to the Chair, in the absence of the President. The Mayor sent in a communication, accompanied with a statement of expenses attending the reception of H. R.H. the Prince of Wales.

docs.snippet: The screw-steamship City of Washington, from Liverpool on the 10th inst., and the Cunard steamship Asia, from Liverpool on the 13th and Queenstown on the 14th inst., have arrived at this port. Their mails are one week later than those received by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The screw-steamship City of Washington, from Liverpool on the 10th inst., and the Cunard steamship Asia, from Liverpool on the 13th and Queenstown on the 14th inst., have arrived at this port. Their mails are one week later than those received by the last arrival, but the City of Washington's advices were partly anticipated by a brief telegraphic summary from Cape Race.
